quest.name: Farewell, and Thanks for the Fish
journal: Wawalago's eyes exude elation and excitement.

An ecstatic Wawalago explains that he has unearthed a wealth of wisdom on the Wadatsumi festivities, and is ready to make the journey east and lead the revival of this time-honored tradition. Ready for the most intense fishing challenge of your career, you make your way to Kugane to rendezvous with Reyna.

You arrive in Kugane to find that Reyna's fellow fishing enthusiast Ansaulme has also taken time away from his struggle for succession to join you and your companions in this grand fishing festival─one that, if all goes according to plan, will also result in the return to the seas of the harutsuge, the shooting stars treasured by the Sahagin. Join Master Wawalago in Isari, and let the festivities begin!

In Isari, Wawalago elaborates on the nature of the festival. At its essence a celebration of the spirit of the cooperation between man and Kojin, the ritual will unfold as follows: the Kojin, joined by Govv, will pursue the plesiosaurs from beneath the waves, chasing them to the surface, where the anglers lying in wait will lure them in. As the guildmaster's most proven protégé, you are tasked by Wawalago with hauling in the lion's share of your prized prey. Make for the waters of Onokoro, and do battle with these ferocious fiends of the deep!

Together with your companions, you haul in heaping pile of plesiosaurs, pleasing the kami of the deep and restoring peace to the oceans and balance to the natural order of things. Govv grows concerned, however, when he can spy no sign of his precious shooting stars despite the removal of their most puissant predator, and dives into the depths in pursuit. At Wawalago's behest, you join him, and after a brief moment of concern, are treated to the stunning sight of a massive school of young harutsuge swimming all around you. Breathing a sigh of relief, you return to the surface with Govv, taking solace that your efforts were not for naught, and these delightful denizens of the sea will survive and prosper. Back in Isari, Wawalago begins to pontificate on the potential repercussions of your actions today, when he is interrupted by an irate Sisipu, who he neglected to inform of his intent to make the journey east. As the two run off, you turn to your companions with a smile, happy to see man and beastman alike united by a deep love of the sea.
objectives: Catch giant plesiosaursDeliver the giant plesiosaurs to Wawalago in Isari.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Ho there, Forename! How are you holding up? For my part, I'm happy to say that I've housed in my head a wide wealth of wisdom regarding this Wadatsumi festival!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Are you ready to fish as if the future depended on it? 'Cause if it's the future of the harutsuge we're discussing, I daresay it most definitely does!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: And with Sisipu being sympathetic for once and sanctioning my sabbatical, there's nothing stopping me from journeying east to join in the festivities! Now if you'll pardon me, I do believe there's a certain lovely lass awaiting our arrival in Kugane.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: As usual, Wawalago is too busy running about to give me the time of day. I trust everything's going swimmingly with whatever it was that you two were working on?

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: My heart's beating so fast it's like to burst out of my body! To Isari, Forename! It's up to us to see that this festival is a sensational success!

dialogue.name: ANSAULME
dialogue.text: The greatest fishing festival in the Far East? Hah! Let my brother do his worst─I wouldn't have missed this for the world!

dialogue.name: REYNA
dialogue.text: We've been waiting for you, friend! Master Wawalago's already gone on ahead to Isari─he couldn't quite contain his excitement. And just look what we have here─Ansaulme's joined us as well.

dialogue.name: REYNA
dialogue.text: Even with his terrible brother wreaking havoc back in the Holy See, he said he couldn't bear to miss it. Truly, the man's ardor for angling knows no bounds─not that I'm one to talk, of course.

dialogue.name: REYNA
dialogue.text: Anyhow, we'd best not keep the guildmaster waiting any longer. Shall we be off to Isari, then?

dialogue.name: REYNA
dialogue.text: So this is Isari! So quiet and peaceful, it certainly has all the makings of a fisher's paradise. Anyhow, shall we get the festivities started?

dialogue.name: ANSAULME
dialogue.text: Ah, how long has it been since I took fishing rod in hand and truly left my worries behind? Mark my words, I will make the most of this day!

dialogue.name: UKIMONO
dialogue.text: We meet again, friend. Know that my fellow Kojin are just off the shore, ready to swim to our aid at a moment's notice.

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: Pssshhh! Finally, the day has come! We will ssspear these plesssiosaur fiends, and the shooting ssstars will grace the ssseas once more!

dialogue.name: JISYOU
dialogue.text: How many years has it been since our Kojin friends graced us with their presence? The sight alone warms this old man's heart. Speaking of which, who─or what─is that talking fish that stands on two legs?

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: I assume we're all accounted for? Excellent! It's time we got the gaieties off the ground, as it were. Obviously, I'll be overseeing the operation.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Our prize and prey is the giant plesiosaur, a massive monstrosity of a fish as fierce and ferocious as any you'll find. Go after one without a precise plan of attack, and you're like as not to get swallowed and spit out a skeleton.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: So it is that the fishermen of Isari have traditionally enlisted the trusty talents of the Kojin in a testament to the power of teamwork.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Here's how it will happen: the Kojin will pursue the prey underwater, pressing them ever closer to the water's crest. From there, us landlubbers will lower our lures and hook them, hauling them to shore in one swift swoop.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: The consummate celebration of cooperation and camaraderie between beastman and beach-dweller─this is the true essence of this time-honored tradition.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Govv! Ukimono! Join the Kojin beneath the billowing waves! When I give the signal, swim after the plesiosaurs and push them in close proximity to Onokoro!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: My friends and fellow fishers! When the stragglers stray near the surface, lower your lures and reel them in with reckless abandon!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: ...A moment, Forename, if you don't mightily mind. Speaking with all sincerity, I'm skeptical that even the most accomplished among us will be able to angle in even one of those primordial piscine predators.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: With the extraordinary exception of you, that is. Yes, if any of us has the aptitude and acumen to face this fearsome foe in the eye and emerge exultant, it's you.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: I'm counting on you, Forename, to prove Wawalago prescient and procure a healthy haul of those plesiosaurs. This will test your talents as a fisher as nothing before. Step forth, and may the seas smile on you!

dialogue.name: REYNA
dialogue.text: They say a band of pirates calling themselves the Confederacy prowls the seas beyond this point? I don't feel like walking any planks, so I'll set up right here, thank you very much.

dialogue.name: ANSAULME
dialogue.text: For this day, I could not care less what my brother is up to at home. Today I live to fish, and only to fish!

dialogue.name: UKIMONO
dialogue.text: How fare you, friend? Have any of those great beasts found your hooks?

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: Pssshhh! To sssee the shooting ssstars return to these seasss, I will ssspare no effort!

dialogue.name: JISYOU
dialogue.text: I pray that the kami of the deep smile on you and reward you with a bountiful catch, my friends.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: The survival of the shooting stars depends on your success, friend. How fare you in the most formidable fishing challenge you've faced?

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Fabulous fishing, friend! But good gods, the tales had it true─these things are more fiend than fish, but you have felled five of them nonetheless!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Hah hah! Now there's a hearty haul, if ever I've eyed one! I daresay there's no doubt the deities of the deep are duly delighted with our deeds.

dialogue.name: UKIMONO
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Swimming through the seas with reckless abandon─I've not had so much fun at a festival in years! I have but one question: when is the next one?

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Hah hah! That's the spirit, my shelled friend. By repeating the ritual on a regular basis, we can protect the seas from the over-proliferation of predators, and see that smaller fish like the harutsuge have a halcyon habitat to call home.

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: Pssshhh... While it pleassses me as much as any that the fessstival was a success and peace returns to the ssseas, I fear I sssee no sign of the shooting ssstars.

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: Pssshhh... Forgive me, Master Wawalago, but I would face the truth with my own eyes!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: I see the Sahagin lad's as serious as ever. Why don't you dive into the depths with him, Forename? Regardless of what he sees, I reckon he'd appreciate if you accompanied him.

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: Pshhh... It is no use. Even down in the depthsss, they are nowhere to be ssseen. Were we too late? Were all our bessst effortsss all for naught?

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: Pshhh... P-Pshhh! B-Behold, Forename! They have come─the shooting ssstars!

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: They are ssstill young─yes, only hatchlings─but look at the shhheer numbersss of them! Yesss, they will grow large and ssstrong, and soon the ssseas will shine bright once more!

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: Pshhh... The shooting stars have sssurvived, and in numbersss beyond my wildest dreams. And with the ranks of their predators culled, they are free to make the journey acrosss the Ruby Sssea!

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: And yet, in time, the plesssiosaurs will return, and the shooting starsss will once again be threatened with extinction. There must be sssomething we can do!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Fear not, my fretful fellow! We need only see to it that the festival is held frequently enough to keep the population of plesiosaurs carefully in check, as it was before the Garleans barged in and bungled everything up.

dialogue.name: UKIMONO
dialogue.text: Ah hah hah! I, for one, would be honored to partake in the festivities any time. Both to reaffirm the bonds we share with our Isari friends, and to ensure the survival of the harutsuge, whose beauty I have now witnessed with my own eyes.

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: Pshhh...! You have my thanksss, friend! You need only sssay the word─I and my fellow Sssahagin will ssswim here to join you!

dialogue.name: GOVV
dialogue.text: I may not possess your ssspearfishing skills, Forename, but my passion to protect the shooting ssstars is sssecond to none! I will do everything in my power to sssee that the legacy you have helped to create livesss on!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Man and beastman, united by an undying devotion to the denizens of the depths─is that water in my eye, or am I welling up? In any event, we've effected a change on the oceans today, a change that will, in turn, come to have consequences for generations to come.

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: But that's a story best not told sober. What say we send for some spirits and sample some of this “sashimi” that the East is famed for?

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: (-???-)I fear you're going to be facing more immediate consequences for your actions today, Wawalago!

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: S-Sisipu! I'm well aware how you worry for me so, but you didn't have to sail straight across─hm? Why the frightful frown on that fetching face of yours?

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: Do you not remember my words the other day, Wawalago? I thought I made myself quite clear.

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: I said that if you wanted to take a leave of absence to join your friends on some adventure, all you had to do was say the word. Then I hear nothing from you for days, and when I went to your usual perch in Fisherman's Bottom─do you have any idea how worried I was for you!?

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: Pardon? I swear that I said─or could it be that I was so absorbed with anticipation that I was remiss in apprising you of my intent to embark on this adventure?

dialogue.name: WAWALAGO
dialogue.text: But Sisipu, my sweet, wasn't it you who always told me never to, ah, neglect...one...in...need? Er, till next time, Forename!

dialogue.name: SISIPU
dialogue.text: Get back here, I say, you good-for-nothing─gah!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In testing new waters as a fisher, you have learned “Enhanced GP Regeneration”!
